sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Koch island.
message_1: What is the total length of the Koch island after the 4th iteration if the initial length of the line segment is 1 unit?
message_2:
The Koch island is formed by applying the Koch curve process to each side of an equilateral triangle. After each iteration, the length of each side of the Koch curve is multiplied by 4/3. 

After the 4th iteration, the length of each side of the Koch curve will be:

Initial length * (4/3)^4 = 1 * (4/3)^4 = 256/81

Since the Koch island is an equilateral triangle, the total length of the Koch island after the 4th iteration will be:

3 * (256/81) = 768/81 units
